wikipedia_page.main: Myfanwy Howell was an early Welsh language radio and television broadcaster, host of Amser Te (Tea Time) in the 1950s.

response: Its Welsh magazine programme was called Amser Te (Tea Time). Amongst other items, it featured a regular cookery item hosted by Myfanwy Howell and the popular Welsh music show Gwlad y Gan.
The format was a general interest magazine programme, which featured a regular cookery item as a tail-end, hosted by Myfanwy Howell.
